Package ss.pentago.network.server

Class Server

  • java.lang.Object
    • ss.pentago.network.server.Server
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AutomatedServer
    public class Server
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable
    Server provides a platform for Clients to connect to and play games together. This class manages the connections with Clients through ClientHandlers, manages their games through the GameManager, and the connectivity through PingPong.

      • Server

        public Server()

    • Method Detail

      • createSocketAt

        public boolean createSocketAt​(int port)
        Tries to create a server socket bound to the specified port. The intended use is to call start() after this function has returned true. This will then run this server in a thread.
        Parameters:
        port - the port to make the Server listen to
        Returns:
        whether server could be started at port (the socket has been created)

      • start

        public void start()
        Starts this Server in a new thread, and start the GameManager in a new thread.

      • run

        public void run()
        While running, just wait for client to connect, and spawn a ClientHandler for them.
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable

      • getPort

        public int getPort()
        Returns the port of the server.
        Returns:
        port

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Sends a disconnections request to all ClientHandlers and stops the server by closing the ServerSocket.

      • pingHandlers

        public boolean pingHandlers()
        Sends out a ping to all logged in Clients.
        Returns:
        false when the server socket is closed to signal that PingPong should stop, true otherwise

      • resetDisconnectionTime

        public void resetDisconnectionTime​(ClientHandler ch)
        Reset the disconnection timer for the specified ClientHandler. This method should be invoked when a ClientHandler receives a pong from the Client. If the time elapsed since the disconnection timer got set is bigger than the disconnection timeout, the ClientHandler will close the socket, effectively kicking the Client. If the time elapsed is less than the timeout, the timer is reset.
        Parameters:
        ch - the client handler

      • checkConnections

        public boolean checkConnections()
        For each connected ClientHandler check how much time has elapsed since it's timer was set. If this is less than the disconnection timeout, the ClientHandler in fact received a pong from its Client, and the connection is still up. However, if the time is more than the disconnection timeout, the associated ClientHandler closes the socket and consequently the Client gets kicked from the server.
        Returns:
        false when the server socket is closed to signal that PingPong should stop, true otherwise

      • sendChat

        public void sendChat​(ClientHandler sender,
                     java.lang.String message)
        Send a message from the server to all clients except the sender.
        Parameters:
        sender - the ClientHandler who sent the message
        message - the protocol encoded message

      • sendWhisper

        public void sendWhisper​(ClientHandler sender,
                        java.lang.String recipient,
                        java.lang.String message)
        Send a private message to the Client with the specified name.
        Parameters:
        sender - the sender
        recipient - the user to sent the private message to
        message - the protocol encoded message

        public boolean isUsernamePresent​(java.lang.String username)

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        false when username is available, true if not

        Returns:
